Posts.Content: May 13, 2009 02:05AM PattyS wrote: I too have an feeling that my cancer began because of the enormous amount of stress I was under for the six or seven years before my diagnosis. I knew when I was going through the stress that I was possibly making myself sick and as it turned out, I was. Thats one of the reasons today that if work, drama from friends or family, or financial matters start to cause me to feel stressed I will back away from it and tell myself it is not worth the worry. Cancer has a way of making you put everything in prospective.
Posts.Title: Has cancer pshycological roots? vivo bygracealone

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2011 10:18AM PattyS wrote: Get in to see your doctor. I would think at your age it is most likely cysts. I had several biopsies done  during my 20's and 30's which all were benign. But you do need to get in to the doctor to be sure. Sending you hugs.
Posts.Title: Scared and need help JPC1987 leaf

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2011 10:25AM PattyS wrote: My daughter who was 22 at the time was experiencing the same symptoms you are describing except I don't think she had a cough. It turned out that she needed to have her tonsils removed. I don't remember why her tonsils were doing this, but having them removed was the solution to the problem.
